subSections.title: Punctuation mark
subSections.text:
{{head|mul|punctuation mark}}

# Ideographic iteration mark, indicating that the previous [[character]] should be repeated.

subSections.title: Punctuation mark
subSections.text:
{{head|zh|symbol}}

# {{non-gloss definition|Used in casual writing as an abbreviation of a repeated character, in vertical writing.}}

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: {{zh-l|二}} (usually appearing as {{lang|zh|〻}}) is used in casual writing to represent a doubled character in vertical writing, but is never used in formal writing or printed matter.

subSections.title: Punctuation mark
subSections.text:
{{ja-punctuation mark}}

# {{lb|ja|now rare}} Ideographic iteration mark, indicating that the previous [[kanji]] should be repeated in vertical writing. The repeated character might not have the same pronunciation as the first due to [[rendaku]].

subSections.title: References
subSections.text: * [http://www.taishukan.co.jp/kanji/qa01.html#Q0009 漢字文化資料館 漢字 Q&A コーナー Q0009 「々」はなんと読むのですか？]
